property.name: text
property.value:
A model of the rijndael encryption system, operating in ECB mode. This model makes heavy use of the class mechanism in Ptolemy II to describe components that are instantiated multiple times in the model.
The algorithm is parameterized to run on 128 bits of data at a time. Executing the model displays two windows of data in hex format. One window shows 128 bits of encrypted data, while the other displays intermediate results in the encryption process after each 'round'

property.name: text
property.value: The convertToString algorithm (with blue halo) is defined here as a single model that is instantiated multiple times. This class definition is local to the model and stored in the same XML file. Modifications to this class will propagate to all instances.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model describes how a sequence of bytes are converted to a string, one byte at a time. Each byte is padded to two hex digits. Note that the title bar of the model indicates that this is the convertToStringClass model, regardless of whether this window was opened by looking inside the icon representing the class itself, or by looking inside one of the instances of the class.
Note that any changes to this class will be reflected in the behavior of all instances, although individual instances may override particular parameter values.

entity.name: SampleDelay
entity.doc: The sdf delay actor, which behaves as an initial token on an arc.

property.name: text
property.value:
This model implements the rijndael block encryption algorithm. It consumes a block of 128 bits, encrypts it, and then outputs 128 encrypted bits. The 128 bit key to be used is specified by the key parameter (an array of unsigned bytes) The roundCount parameter gives the number of cipher rounds that should be performed, and should be 10 for 128 bit data and 128 bit key.
Note that this model contains another instance of the convertToString class defined at the toplevel, as well as three more class definitions that are used by various internal models.

property.name: text
property.value: This block implements the key expansion and key selection. It basically implements a random number generator that uses the 128 bit user key as a seed.

entity.name: SampleDelay
entity.doc: The sdf delay actor, which behaves as an initial token on an arc.

entity.name: SampleDelay2
entity.doc: The sdf delay actor, which behaves as an initial token on an arc.

property.name: text
property.value: Create a state machine here (and ports, if needed) and create refinements for the states. Each refinement needs a director. For hybrid system models, use the CTEmbeddedDirector.

property.name: text
property.value: Create a state machine here (and ports, if needed) and create refinements for the states. Each refinement needs a director. For hybrid system models, use the CTEmbeddedDirector.

property.name: text
property.value: The final encryption round, which is similar to a normal encryption round, except that it lacks the MixColumn operation. This makes encryption and decryption more symmetric.

property.name: text
property.value: The 'first' encryption round, which just XORs the key

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
